abstract:
A new approach in human identification is investigated. For this
purpose, a standard 12-lead electrocardiogram (ECG) recorded during rest
is used. Selected features extracted from the ECG are used to identify a
person in a predetermined group. Multivariate analysis is used for the
identification task. Experiments show that it is possible to identify a
person by features extracted from one lead only. Hence, only three
electrodes have to be attached on the person to be identified. This
makes the method applicable without too much effort
